description: An examination of pivotal events in the history of Native peoples in North America. Students will explore the complexity of encounters between American Indians and others through a focus on key moments. These will include religious encounters, military confrontations, and legal struggles as well as social and artistic interactions. Same as AIS 277.
label: Encounters in Native America
sectionDegreeAttributes: Hist&Philosoph Perspect, and US Minority Culture(s) course.
